title: run_trial.bash fails if host uid and gid are not 1000

content.raw:
The vrx-server  Dockerfile attempts to create the vrx-server so its user matches the username of the host system. However, it hard codes uid and gid to 1000. If the user running the container has different uid or gid, the server’s home environment won’t be configured correctly, and the relative path shortcut “~” will be empty. This will cause the run\_trial.bash script to fail to find the vrx\_ws directory it needs to initialize the server.

A quick workaround is to change the uid and gid values in the Dockerfile to match the uid and gid of the user on the host.
